analysis: The documents primarily concern the inspection of tax returns by various governmental bodies, including congressional committees, federal agencies like the Department of Agriculture and the Federal Trade Commission, and even foreign entities like the Department of National Revenue of Canada. The reasons for inspection vary, ranging from investigations into subversive activities and government efficiency to administering tax conventions and studying specific sectors like farming or banking. The documents authorize these inspections under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code and other related acts.
title: Authorizing Governmental Access to Tax Information
